quotes: who serves as the United Nations (UN) Secretary General (SG)'s Envoy on Technology since June 2022.
He is also a member of the UN SG's Advisory Body on Artificial Intelligence since October 2023.
He was a visiting fellow at Stanford University's Center for International Security and Cooperation (CISAC) during 2008–2009.
Gill began his diplomatic career in 1992 and served in various capacities in the Indian Embassy in Tehran, Iran, and the High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka.
He also headed the DISA Division from 2013 to 2016.
Senior Indian diplomat Amandeep Singh Gill appointed U.N. Envoy on Technology. 11 June 2022.
Henshall, Will (21 September 2023). 'How the U.N. Plans to Shape the Future of AI'.
Dixit, Pranav (13 December 2023). 'India has a unique vantage position on how AI could play out: UN Tech Envoy Amandeep Singh Gill'.
'Secretary-General's Advisory Body Members - Artificial Intelligence'. 26 October 2023.
Mukherjee, Supantha (27 October 2023). 'United Nations creates advisory body to address AI governance'.
Amandeep Singh Gill (2 January 2020). 'Imagining the AI future'.
'India has unique position on how AI could play out in the Global South: UN tech envoy'. Economic Times. PTI. 13 December 2023.
Peltz, Jennifer (26 September 2023). 'The UN's tech policy chief is optimistic about AI even though it could subvert democracy, delude society at large and make us less human'.
Retrieved 17 January 2024.
